back:
The extent to which data correctly describes the real-world object or event it represents. Accurate data is free from errors and correctly reflects the truth.

Data comes from sources that are verifiable and trustworthy.

The degree to which all required data is present.

Complete data contains all necessary elements and values needed for its intended use.

The degree to which data is up-to-date and available within a suitable time frame.

Timely data ensures that information is current and readily accessible when needed.

The degree to which data is uniformly consistent within a dataset and across different datasets - and systems.

Consistent data does not have conflicting or redundant values, allowing integration and comparison of data from multiple systems.

The extent to which each record is unique within a dataset.

Unique data ensures that there are no duplicate records and each entry is distinct.

The degree to which data conforms to the defined formats, rules, and constraints.

Valid data adheres to predefined standards and business rules.
